3: Judging by photograph, it appears Luna did take something from the Arctic route Union after all.
But it is hard to tell what it is from this angle.
Could it be...
But if it really was what he thought it was, why would there be such a thing in the ARU?
What are they planning on using it for? And what does Luna intend on doing with it?
An ominous thought came to his mind, causing Asimov to subconsciously look at the time.
It seems unlikely, but it'd best to confirm it, then tell the President. Ugh, forget it.
He presses the name of another person in his comm log currently overwhelmed with work.
What is it?
The President gave me quite the headache of an assignment. Now he's gone off to sleep. Think you can get me in touch with survivors from the ARU?
I estimate that the Forest Guard and Forsaken are still there. I need to confirm some information with them.
Wait... Survivors?
Celica was stunned for a moment, before coming to her senses.
Understood... Wait a moment.
After disconnecting the comm link, Asimov waited for five minutes in a state of perplexity over his work.
Apologies, sir. I tried contacting numerous people, but I couldn't get through to anyone.
...Looks like the radio signal transmitter has also been destroyed.
Where should we go from here?
Let Hassen get some rest.
Any teams that have been to the ARU available for dispatch?
Unfortunately, there have been too many missions as of late.
The sound of Celica's rapidly parsing the attendance record is picked up through the comm link.
According to the current mission schedule, the Gray Ravens are the squad that can return to Babylonia the fastest.
Who's the unlucky one...?
If the mission is urgent, I can ask the Gray Ravens to abandon their current mission and return pronto.
I still have to confirm something first.
Have the Gray Ravens wait for me in the conference room once they return.
Understood.
